definition: the spatial arrangement of something as distinct from its substance, give shape or form to
details:
noun
- the spatial arrangement of something as distinct from its substance
= synonyms: shape
- a mold for setting concrete
= example: a mold for setting concrete
- a life-size dummy used to display clothes
= synonyms: manakin, mannequin, manikin, mannikin
- the visual appearance of something or someone
= synonyms: shape
- a particular mode in which something is manifested
= example: a particular mode in which something is manifested
- any spatial attributes (especially as defined by outline)
= synonyms: shape
- an ability to perform well
= example: an ability to perform well
- alternative names for the body of a human being
= synonyms: shape
- a category of things distinguished by some common characteristic or quality
= example: a category of things distinguished by some common characteristic or quality
= synonyms: kind, variety, sort
- a perceptual structure
= example: a perceptual structure
= synonyms: shape
- the phonological or orthographic sound or appearance of a word that can be used to describe or identify something
= example: the phonological or orthographic sound or appearance of a word that can be used to describe or identify something
= synonyms: descriptor, word form, signifier
- a printed document with spaces in which to write
= example: a printed document with spaces in which to write
- an arrangement of the elements in a composition or discourse
= example: an arrangement of the elements in a composition or discourse
- (biology) a group of organisms within a species that differ in trivial ways from similar groups
= synonyms: strain
- a body of students who are taught together
= synonyms: course, class, grade
- (physical chemistry) a distinct state of matter in a system
= synonyms: phase
verb
- give shape or form to
= synonyms: shape
- assume a form or shape
= example: assume a form or shape
- make something, usually for a specific function
= synonyms: shape
- establish or impress firmly in the mind
- create (as an entity)
= example: create (as an entity)
= synonyms: organise, organize
- to compose or represent:'This wall forms the background of the stage setting'
= synonyms: make
- develop into a distinctive entity
= synonyms: spring, take form, take shape
